relation: Overrides the IGP administrative weight of the link.
Configures affinity (the properties that the tunnel requires in its links) for an MPLS-TE tunnel.
Configures the attribute names for the interface.
Enables MPLS-TE on an interface and enters MPLS-TE interface configuration mode.
pageTitle: Cisco ASR 9000 Series Aggregation Services Router MPLS Command Reference, Release 5.1.x - MPLS Traffic Engineering Commands [Cisco ASR 9000 Series Aggregation Services Routers] - Cisco

textBeforeTable: Syntax Description bandwidth ] minimum [ min percentage adjustment-threshold no bandwidth ] minimum [ min percentage adjustment-threshold To configure the tunnel bandwidth change threshold to trigger an adjustment, use the adjustment-threshold command in MPLS-TE automatic bandwidth interface configuration mode. To disable this feature, use the no form of this command. adjustment-threshold (MPLS-TE) tunnel-id (auto-tunnel pcc) tunnel-id (auto-tunnel p2mp) tunnel-id (auto-tunnel backup) topology holddown sigerr (MPLS-TE) timeout (soft-preemption) timers removal unused (auto-tunnel backup) timers loose-path (MPLS-TE) srlg soft-preemption frr-rewrite soft-preemption snmp traps mpls traffic-eng signalling advertise explicit-null (MPLS-TE) signalled-name signalled-bandwidth show srlg show mpls traffic-eng link-management soft-preemption show mpls traffic-eng tunnels auto-bw brief show mpls traffic-eng tunnels show mpls traffic-eng topology show mpls traffic-eng preemption log show mpls traffic-eng pce tunnels show mpls traffic-eng pce peer show mpls traffic-eng maximum tunnels show mpls traffic-eng link-management summary show mpls traffic-eng link-management statistics show mpls traffic-eng link-management interfaces show mpls traffic-eng link-management igp-neighbors
textAfterTable: Release Modification Release 3.9.1 This command was introduced. Usage Guidelines To use this command, you must be in a user group associated with a task group that includes appropriate task IDs. If the user group assignment is preventing you from using a command, contact your AAA administrator for assistance. If you configure or modify the adjustment threshold while the automatic bandwidth is already running, the next band-aids application is impacted for that tunnel. The new adjustment threshold determines if an actual bandwidth takes place. Examples The following example configures the tunnel bandwidth change threshold to trigger an adjustment:  RP/0/RSP0/CPU0:router# configure RP/0/RSP0/CPU0:router(config)# interface tunnel-te 1 RP/0/RSP0/CPU0:router(config-if)# auto-bw RP/0/RSP0/CPU0:router(config-if-tunte-autobw)# adjustment-threshold 20 min 500 Related Commands Command Description application (MPLS-TE) Configures the application frequency, in minutes, for the
